scenario_text.value: Hm? Takuma, Agumon, is that you?

I see you’ve been searching the forest,
Renamon.
Any luck? Did you find Aoi and Labramon?

No... I’m afraid I haven’t been able to find
any trace of them.

But it’s too soon to give up just yet.
I intend to keep searching.

Renamon... Thank you for helping us look for
her.

No, if anything, I should be thanking you
for accepting me after all I did.

You even agreed to help save Miyuki. Helping
you now is the least I can do.

Haha, well I’m still happy to have your help.
It feels like you’re finally one of us now.

Yeah! You’re one of our friends too, Renamon!
All the more reason for us to save Miyuki!

The problem is where she might be. I don’t
have the first clue where to look for her.
Oh, I know exactly where Miyuki is.
What?! Are you serious?!

Then why keep it a secret?! You should’ve
just told everyone before!

It’s not like I was trying to hide it. It
just didn’t seem like the time to mention it.

I thought our top priority should be finding
and rescuing Aoi.

Besides, the Master doesn’t have many
monsters like Piemon that do his bidding.

So even if the Master intends to attack us,
we should have some time.
Really?

The Master lost a lot of his forces at the
library, so that much seems certain.

Anyway, I was thinking we could talk things
over after we find Aoi and everyone’s back.

Got it. I’ll be looking forward to it. In the
meantime, you’re right, we need to find Aoi.

I’ll tell you where Miyuki is after we’ve
found Aoi and everyone’s back together.
